pullRequest.title: Feature/0202 supported character sets
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #950
This PR is [ready] for review.
Risk
This PR makes [minor] API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE, and Java EE

Unit Tests
Unit tests have been updated to account for deprecated Character Sets and for new Character Sets
Core Tests
Tested against the CharacterSet branches of Core and Sdl_Hmi and ensured TextFields are appearing correctly. Also verified that UTF_8 characters were able to be displayed in the text fields.
smartdevicelink/sdl_hmi#384
smartdevicelink/sdl_core#3454
Summary
These changes deprecate the old CharacterSet enums(TYPE2SET, TYPE5SET, CID1SET, CID2SET) and adds 3 new enums(ASCII, ISO_8859_1, and UTF_8) and UTF_8 is the new prefered CharacterSet
CLA

 I have signed the CLA

commit.message: Update Character Sets from RPC SPEC
Update Tests and replace CID2SET references

nodes.bodyText: Can we also update the descrption for getCharacterSet()?
Can we remove all formatting changes in this class and keep only the new additions?

adding  @since SmartDeviceLink 7.0.0 to the old values is confusing because it can be understood that it got added in version 7. Can we update the javadoc to make it more clear that it got deprecated in 7? there should be a more standard way of doing that. if not we can simply remove it.
